entry.title: Frances Darlington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although sculptor Frances Darlington (pictured) was known for her painted relief panels, she also designed a railway poster?

entry.title: a shrine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a shrine dedicated to the fictional character Ianto Jones is visited by people from around the world?

entry.title: American Samoa at the 2020 Summer Olympics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a sprinter who competed for American Samoa at the 2020 Summer Olympics had never competed in a sprinting event beforehand?

entry.title: Dorothy Dworkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that immigrant midwife Dorothy Dworkin was considered the matriarch of Toronto's Mount Sinai Hospital?

entry.title: an Alabama TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an Alabama TV station fired nearly its entire news staff and replaced its newscasts with a countdown clock for more than a month?

entry.title: Kelvite sounding machine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Kelvite sounding machine used a chemical reaction to determine the depth of water in which a ship was sailing?

entry.title: Georg Kareski (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Zionist activist Georg Kareski defended the Nuremberg Laws in a Nazi newspaper?

entry.title: Department of State v. Muñoz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2024 U.S. Supreme Court case Department of State v. Muñoz decided that the fundamental right to marry does not give a U.S. citizen a right to challenge their spouse's visa denial?

entry.title: Toby Olubi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Toby Olubi helped fund his Olympic bobsled career by being "shot out of a cannon"?
